nodes.bodyText: S390 contains a 31 bit, and 64bit addressing modes. The string on Z/OS does not actually have a "64" to signify that it's operating on a 64 bit addressing mode.
It would be good to have a comment to explain this.
Done. I've added the comment and squashed it. Thanks for the feedback.

It should be z/OS does.
I don't see how z/OS 31-bit can be detected property. Not sure why the test uses os.arch to get the address mode, there is a better property that works across all platforms.
z/OS 31-bit sun.arch.data.model = 32
z/OS 64-bit sun.arch.data.model = 64
Thanks for pointing that out. I've added that logic here 3187061.
